item.title: Hint icon
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

		if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("showhint")) {
		createArrow(1, 1);
		//createSurfaceArrow(3265, 3427, 0, 2, 1);
}

That was just a simple command I made.

in client.java go to case 72
You should see something like this

Add this

So when you click a npc it will spit out a ID, now. I didn’t get it to do it for attackable NPC’s, it goes by the order in the spawn.cfg(I believe) so put the guide #1 and add it so when you first log in it will add the arrow above his head. It automatically blinks. Then from there you can add it to other npcs. It’s isn’t their NPC ID like 945, it goes by their id in the spawn because then it would just put icons over all the npc’s with that id. It’s a crappy way of making it like a data value.

I also renamed the second one to createSurfaceArrow, so it would help with confusion.

[code=java] public void createArrow(int type, int id) {
outStream.createFrame(254); //The packet ID
outStream.writeByte(type); //1=NPC, 10=Player
outStream.writeWord(id); //NPC/Player ID
outStream.write3Byte(0); //Junk
}

public void createSurfaceArrow(int x, int y, int height, int pos, int arrow) {
	outStream.createFrame(254); //The packet ID
	outStream.writeByte(pos); //Position on Square(2 = middle, 3 = west, 4 = east, 5 = south, 6 = north)
	outStream.writeWord(x); //X-Coord of Object
	outStream.writeWord(y); //Y-Coord of Object
	outStream.writeByte(height); //Height off Ground
	headIconhint = arrow;
}

public void resetArrow() {
}[/code]

It’s pretty much the same thing as you have.
http://img842.imageshack.us/img842/3493/spadesscape.png

Read full topic

item.title: Hint icon
item.dc:creator: @jaruanna jaruanna
item.description:
@jaruanna wrote:

hey guys i am making a hint icon (yellow arrow above heads) and i found out this:

[code] public void createArrow(int type, int id) {
outStream.createFrame(254); //The packet ID
outStream.writeByte(type); //1=NPC, 10=Player
outStream.writeWord(id); //NPC/Player ID
outStream.write3Byte(0); //Junk
}

public void createArrow(int x, int y, int height, int pos) {
	outStream.createFrame(254); //The packet ID
	outStream.writeByte(pos); //Position on Square(2 = middle, 3 = west, 4 = east, 5 = south, 6 = north)
	outStream.writeWord(x); //X-Coord of Object
	outStream.writeWord(y); //Y-Coord of Object
	outStream.writeByte(height); //Height off Ground
	}
public void resetArrow() {
createArrow(1, -1);
}[/code]

and then i did createArrow(1, 945); below the npc void. and it didnt show up. whats wrong?

Read full topic
